alert.note: Alert for Gallatin; Madison (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 13 at 1:45PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Madison and central Gallatin Counties through 215 PM MDT... At 143 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms clustered around 16 miles northwest of Crescent Lake, or 28 miles south of Bozeman, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Big Sky. This includes Highway 191 between mile markers 31 and 67. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall may also lead to minor localized flooding and debris flow down steep slopes. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
